result.execSummary:
The defendant Deangelo Lamar Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be waived due to indigency.

DNA surcharges are to be paid by 10-10-17.
Failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deangelo Lamar Cooper

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deangelo Lamar Cooper in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Deangelo Lamar Cooper in custody.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State has satisfied victim notification.  Defendant sworn.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharges.

  Sentencing proceeded.   Statements made as to sentencing.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, with 60 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered applicable costs, fees and surcharges to be waived due to indigency.       
DNA surcharges are to be paid by 10/10/2017 to convert to a civil judgment with tax intercept.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Defendant Deangelo Lamar Cooper in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Deangelo Lamar Cooper in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($500.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 500.00.
